context: The secret of "age" of human male and female ancestors is hidden in Y chromosome and mitochondria. Y chromosome only passes from father to child, while mitochondria only pass from mother to daughter. By tracing back these two genetic materials, it can be found that all men have the same male ancestor "Y-chromosomal Adam", and all women have the same female ancestor "Mitochondrial Eve". The researchers sequenced the genome of 69 men from Asia, Africa, Latin America and other countries representing 9 different populations, and made comparative analysis. The results showed that this common ancestor of men, "Y-chromosomal Adam", was formed at about 15. 60000 to 120000 years ago. Using the same technical analysis of mitochondria, researchers have calculated that the female common ancestor, "Mitochondrial Eve," formed in 14. 80000 years to 90000 years. 90000 years ago.
question: Which of the following is most appropriate as a deduction for the above discussion?
answers: "Y-chromosomal Adam" and "Mitochondrial Eve" were formed at the same time, the "age" was relatively close, and "Y-chromosomal Adam" might be earlier

context: By analyzing the light emitted or absorbed by the atoms of an object, we can measure whether the object is far away from the earth or near the earth. When the object is far away from the Terrestrial Time, the frequency of these light will move to the red end (low frequency) of the spectrum, referred to as "red shift", otherwise, it is called "blue shift". This unique light emitted by the atom is also affected by the mass of the elementary particle, especially the electrons, that make up the atom. If the mass of an atom increases, the energy of the photons it releases will also become higher, resulting in a blue shift in the release and absorption frequencies. On the contrary, if the particles become lighter and lighter, the frequency will shift red. Astronomical observations have found that most galaxies exhibit redshift, and the farther they are from Earth, the greater the redshift. Therefore, many scientists believe that the universe must be constantly expanding.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best refute the views of the aforementioned scientists?
answers: In the distant universe, individual blue shifted celestial bodies have also been discovered

From the perspective of other celestial bodies in the universe, redshift is also a absolute advantage phenomenon

In China, the prerequisite for university ranking is far from being met, and recognized university ranking institutions have not yet emerged. Therefore, it is currently not suitable for China to conduct university rankings.
question: Which of the following does not constitute a rebuttal to the above argument?
answers: University rankings have a significant impact on the reputation of the school and the application of candidates.
There is not such a close relationship between university rankings and mature market economy systems.
The ranking of enterprises is not easy and not entirely accurate, only for reference value.
Recognized ranking institutions can only be generated from ranking practices.

context: Researchers found that eating more than five servings of yams, corn, carrots, onions or other similar vegetables every day can reduce the risk of pancreatic cancer. They surveyed 2230 respondents, including 532 patients with pancreatic cancer. Then they classified the agricultural products consumed by cancer patients, asked them about their other living habits, such as overall diet and smoking, and compared them with the living habits of other 1701 people. The results showed that people who ate at least five servings of vegetables a day were half as likely to suffer from pancreatic cancer as those who ate less than two servings of vegetables a day.
question: Which of the following questions does not question the reliability of the above research conclusions?
answers: Are all the statements made by the respondents in the survey true?
What is the proportion of men and women in pancreatic cancer patients?
Are there any important omissions in the differences in living habits between pancreatic cancer patients and non pancreatic cancer patients involved in the survey?
Is there any genetic reason for pancreatic cancer patients?

context: In China, the concept of privatization seems to be the division of state-owned assets. In essence, it is a matter of protecting the ownership of private property. context: The Municipal Women's Federation conducted a questionnaire survey on 8100 children and adolescents aged 9 to 12 in this city. context: It is no longer new for college students to use their holidays as nannies. A survey shows that 63% of respondents approve of college students as nannies, but when asked if their families would hire college students as nannies, nearly 60% of them said "no".

context: In order to alleviate the shortage of oil, China began to industrialize the technology of converting corn into fuel ethanol five years ago, commonly known as "grain to oil", and has now become a relatively mature industry. context: Commentator: The official ban on setting off fireworks in cities during the Spring Festival on the grounds of firefights injuring people and causing fires, rather than trying to guide people to seek benefits and avoid harm, implies conscious or unconscious cultural discrimination. context: Economist: Recently, Comrade W's report suggested changing the housing pre-sale system to current home sales, which has sparked heated debate. context: The Silent Spring, written by American science writer Rachel Carson, is hailed as the pioneering work of the modern environmental movement in the West. context: In both "Le Ji" and "Zhi Ci", there are phrases such as "heaven and earth are inferior" and "birds of a feather flock together, birds of a feather flock together". context: In today's globalized economy, Western cultural classics and traditions still exist and continue. context: The problem faced by a developing country is that in order to maintain its economic development, it is necessary to continuously strengthen the competitiveness of domestic enterprises; To maintain social stability, it is necessary to continuously establish and improve social security systems such as elderly care, medical care, and unemployment. context: Zhang Wei received an A in all her extracurricular assignments, and if she also received an A in her term paper, even without giving a class presentation, she would still be able to pass the exam. context: In June this year, the water level of Dongting Lake rose rapidly, inundating a large area of lakes and beaches. context: A new medical technology can only be clinically used when its efficacy and safety are truly reliable. context: In recent years, housing prices in China have skyrocketed. context: Naturalists have observed that there is usually a strict hierarchy in a group of birds, and birds of high status bully birds of low status. context: Psychologists' long-term observation of a shopping mall parking lot has found that when a car is quietly waiting to enter the parking space, the driver takes an average of 39 seconds to exit the parking space; When the waiting car owner honks impatiently, it takes an average of 51 seconds for the driver to exit the parking space; When there are no cars waiting to enter the parking space, the driver takes an average of 32 seconds to exit the parking space. context: The traditional view holds that the origin of the names of the Eight Trigrams and the Sixty Four Trigrams in the Book of Changes is based on the theory of taking images or meanings, and there is no other explanation. For example, the image of the Kun hexagram is pure yin, and yin is the main principle of softness. Therefore, this hexagram is called Kun, and Kun is the meaning of softness

context: Thomas. Pan En discussed whether the monarchy system and the hereditary system are reasonable in Common Sense. context: The People's Bank of China announced that from July 20, 2013, it will fully loosen the control on loan interest rates for financial institutions. context: The sun about 2 billion years ago was 30% darker than the current sun. If the current sun were as dim as it was then, the oceans on Earth would completely freeze into ice. However, fossil evidence suggests that; Liquid water and life existed on Earth as early as 3.8 billion years ago.

context: Expert: The board of directors of listed companies is usually composed of major shareholders, and small shareholders cannot enter the board due to their small equity. But independent directors are hired and paid by the company's board of directors, which forms an economic "alliance" relationship between independent directors and the company's board of directors, making it difficult for independent directors to exercise their powers from the perspective of minority shareholders.

context: Many people believe that online dating is unreliable. A research group at the University of Chicago conducted a study on 1. context: When local governments auction land, there is a basic price called the "land base price"; The ratio of the amount of auction proceeds exceeding the land base price to the land base price is called the "premium rate". The high or low premium rate indicates the heat of the land and real estate markets. A piece of land in B city was temporarily suspended during its first listing this year due to a record high premium rate. The second listing ultimately resulted in a transaction at a premium rate lower than the first listing, but the total transaction amount exceeded the amount that could have been achieved in the first listing.
question: If the following statements are true, which one best explains the seemingly inconsistent phenomenon mentioned above?
answers: When the land in B city was listed for the second time, the government raised its land base price.

When the land in B city went public for the second time, the competition among developers was much more intense than the first time.

context: Recently, New Zealand's Fonterra Dairy Group reported to the government that one of its raw material samples contained botulinum toxin. In fact, both New Zealand and China's milk powder testing programs do not include Botulinum toxin, and there are no reports of related products causing diseases. Fonterra's self disclosure of its wrongdoing may be due to the company's moral conscience, or it may be due to concerns about punishment, as in New Zealand, if a company fails to promptly address food safety issues, it will face severe penalties. From this, it can be seen that Fonterra's self disclosure of domestic ugliness is not truly based on moral conscience.
question: Which of the following reasoning has the same logical error as the above reasoning?
answers: You cannot have both fish and bear's paws, you can take bear's paws and give up fish.
The perpetrator is either A or B. It has been found that the perpetrator is A, so the perpetrator is not B.
If a person is immersed in secular life, they cannot become philosophers. So, if you want to become a philosopher, you should give up the lifestyle of ordinary people.
Food and clothing are sufficient to know honor and disgrace, so insufficient food and clothing do not know honor and disgrace.

context: During World War II, the US and British air forces launched a major bombing campaign against Germany, resulting in heavy losses for themselves. Experts found that all returned aircraft had bullet marks on their abdomen, but their wings were intact. They infer from this that the belly of the aircraft is very susceptible to artillery fire, and the protection of the belly should be improved. It was later confirmed that these experts' inference was affected by the "survivorship bias", because the actual situation was that all the planes hit the wings fell, while most of the planes hit only the belly returned.
question: Each of the following statements has a similar "survivorship bias", except
answers: Beautiful and handsome men have a great advantage in the workplace competition, as they are easy to obtain high paying positions.
It is easy to succeed if you drop out of college and start a business, for example, Bill Gates.
Smoking may be beneficial for health and longevity, for example, Deng Xiaoping and Huang Yongyu are both veteran smokers, but they all live a long life.
In a random sampling survey with a sufficiently large sample size, it was found that the television program with the highest audience in China is "News Broadcast".

context: My running ability has never been very strong, but since using X-brand running shoes, my running performance has greatly improved. Therefore, anyone who wants to improve their running performance should buy X-brand running shoes.
question: From the above, we can draw a more reasonable conclusion than the one drawn by 'me', except that

context: Scientist: It has been proven that adopting new farming methods can reduce the use of fertilizers, insecticides, and antibiotics on some well managed farms without significantly reducing or even increasing yields. context: Commentator: With the increasing prevalence of electronic monitoring of employees and the increasing invasiveness of personal privacy, I have also heard more and more arguments from employers regarding this practice. context: No computer can do everything that the human brain can do, because some problems cannot be solved by running any mechanical program. And computers can only solve problems by running mechanical programs.

context: In the novel Military Regulation 22 by the American writer Joseph Heller, it is stipulated in Military Regulation 22 that only when a serviceman is mentally abnormal and he applies to stop flying, can he be allowed to stop flying. context: Judges in some states in the United States are elected. Elections usually require financial support from interest groups, which may directly or indirectly affect judicial fairness. context: Physics concepts are usually very standardized and rigorous, and the physical quantities represented by physics terms have clear definitions, measurement methods, and conversion relationships. context: Traditional memory theory holds that memory is like a video tape, where each memory is retrieved from the brain and played back at a specific time. The scene construction theory provides another explanation for memory: the human brain only records some fragments when encoding memory; When needed, the human brain connects and supplements these fragments in a logical and consistent manner with the subject's current belief state to form memories.
question: The phenomena listed below are all phenomena that can be explained by scenario construction theory but cannot be explained by traditional memory theory, except for
answers: Some Alzheimer's patients may lose their memory ability.
The content of multiple memories of the same past can change.
A statistic shows that in 20% to 25% of cases, eyewitnesses will identify individuals who the police know are incorrect.
Kimberly Weber, a British psychologist, successfully implanted false memory about childhood life into his or her subjects by showing them some synthetic false photos.

context: At the beginning of 2013, Beijing experienced continuous haze weather for several days, and the "Beijing cough" caused by air pollution became one of the hot topics discussed by people. In order to solve the problem of haze, some experts suggest starting with buses, taxis, and municipal public vehicles, replacing fuel vehicles with electric vehicles, and gradually promoting them to other social vehicles in the future.

context: Since 1987, China's birth rate has gradually declined. answers: The process of "aging" in Chinese society is accelerating, and relevant departments have proposed delaying retirement to solve the problem of pension shortage.

context: The function of the government is to meet the true needs of the people. Unless the government knows what the people truly need, it cannot meet those needs. Freedom of speech can ensure that government officials hear such demand information. Therefore, for a healthy country, freedom of speech is essential.
question: If the following statements are true, which one cannot weaken the conclusion of the above argument?
answers: Freedom of speech is not sufficient to meet the needs of the people, and a good social order is also indispensable.
The legitimate function of government is not to meet the needs of the people, but to provide them with equal opportunities.
Government officials are diligent, love the people, and fulfill their duties. They already know what the people need and what dissatisfaction they have.
Freedom of speech leads to public uproar and can easily disrupt social order, and good social order is a prerequisite for the government to meet the needs of the people.

context: Zhang Qiang: When a region's economy is sluggish, many people are unemployed, so they reduce their living expenses, resulting in more unemployment and economic deterioration. The economy continues to deteriorate, and prices eventually reach their lowest point. Low prices stimulate people to increase their living expenses, which in turn leads to an improvement in economic conditions. Li Ming: If people are unemployed, they will not be able to increase their consumption and have no money to purchase goods other than basic necessities. Therefore, lowering prices to the lowest point will not lead to an improvement in economic conditions.
question: If the following statements are true, which one can most weaken Li Ming's refutation of Zhang Qiang?
answers: After the economic situation improves, the company will hire more people, and many rehired people will purchase products that were previously postponed.
Even if the economic situation continues to deteriorate, consumers still believe that the economic situation will eventually improve.
Even in situations of extreme economic deterioration, the unemployed must continue to purchase essential goods such as food.
During periods of economic deterioration, even those who are not unemployed will compress their expenses; When prices drop to their lowest point, they have savings available for consumption.

context: The medieval Arabs had many ancient Greek manuscripts. When needed, they translate them into Arabic. Medieval Arab philosophers were very interested in Aristotle's Poetics, and this interest was clearly not shared by Arab poets, because a poet interested in the Poetics would definitely want to read Homer's poetry, and Aristotle himself often quoted Homer's poetry. However, Homer's poetry was not translated into Arabic until contemporary times.
question: If the following statement is true, which one strongly supports the above argument?
answers: Some medieval Arab translators have manuscripts of Homeric poetry in ancient Greek.
Aristotle's "On Poetry" is often cited and commented upon by modern Arab poets.
Most of Aristotle's "Poetics" is related to drama, and medieval Arabs also wrote and performed dramatic works.
The series of stories in medieval Arabia, such as "Arabian Nights," are very similar to certain parts of Homer's epic.

context: The Federal Reserve has been wanting to launch a third round of quantitative easing monetary policy (QE3) to promote the recovery of the US economy. If the Federal Reserve launches QE3, the global supply of US dollars will increase significantly again, and countries will have to purchase US dollar assets to maintain exchange rate stability. If countries purchase US dollar assets, it will increase their inflationary pressure. If you don't want to import inflation, countries need to let their currencies appreciate. If the local currency appreciates, it will suppress domestic exports and lead to an economic downturn.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following statements must be true?
answers: If the Federal Reserve launches QE3, other countries should not purchase US dollar assets if they want to avoid their own economic downturn.
Other countries may face pressure from imported inflation or the risk of economic decline.
If other countries do not have imported inflation and their currencies appreciate, then the Federal Reserve has not launched QE3.
If other countries do not face the pressure of imported inflation, they will not let their currencies appreciate.

context: On August 10, 2012, South Korean President Lee Myung bak visited Dokdo (known as "Takeshima" in Japan), which has a sovereignty dispute with Japan. The public opinion survey results show that after Lee Myung bak's visit to Dokdo, his support rating increased from 25. 7% to 34. 7%.
question: If the investigation result is true, which of the following statements must be true?
answers: More South Koreans support Lee Myung bak's visit to Dokdo than those who do not.

context: The modern French philosopher Pascal once argued that either there is a Christian God, or there is none. If you believe in God's existence and live according to the Christian way, then if God does exist, you will receive endless happiness: if God does not exist, you will lose very little. However, if you do not believe in the existence of God and do not live according to the Christian way, if God does not exist, you will not lose anything: if God does exist, you will receive endless punishment. So, don't hesitate anymore, choose to believe in God's existence and live according to the Christian way.
question: Which of the following is the most reasonable explanation for the logical loophole in this argument?
answers: This argument mistakenly assumes that a person can choose to believe or not believe in the existence of God at will.
Pascal transformed faith into a matter of self-interest calculation.
If God does not exist, but we choose to believe in Him, it will lead to our erroneous understanding of the world and muddle through our lives.
There are multiple religions in this world, and each religion has a god (God) with boundless power. They will impose unlimited punishment on those who do not believe in themselves.

question: The above arguments of politicians are most susceptible to criticism because

It used an unrepresentative small sample as evidence.
It attempts to achieve the purpose of persuasion by appealing to emotions.
It erroneously indicates that the economists mentioned are not experts in the field of consumer prices.

That's how the gap arises!
question: Which of the following conclusions cannot be reasonably drawn from the above statements?
answers: A tiny drop is a thousand miles away.
Details determine success or failure, character determines fate.
The continuous accumulation and amplification of small differences can produce huge differences.
Everyone must be careful of every step in the process of life: small victories may accumulate into big victories, and small mistakes may lead to big mistakes.

context: Economist: The personal income tax in the United States is a progressive tax, and the tax law is extremely complex. People who want to pay taxes honestly often have misunderstandings; And there is a declaration error; And those who deliberately avoid taxes can always find loopholes in tax laws. Generally speaking, the size of tax avoidance space is directly proportional to the complexity of the tax system, and the level of tax avoidance ability is directly proportional to the income level of taxpayers. Most of the tax avoidance space caused by the complex tax system will be used by the rich, making the progressive tax not reach the progressive degree stipulated in the tax law, and its function of regulating distribution will also be greatly weakened.
question: If the following statements are true, which one provides the strongest support for the economist's above argument?
answers: When filing taxes, 60% of people in the United States need to hire professionals to represent them, and 22% of people need to use tax filing software to help calculate.
In 1981, Americans put forward the idea of "abolishing progressive tax rates and implementing a single tax rate".
From 1988 to 2006, the income of the wealthiest group in the United States increased from 15% to 22% of national income, but their average tax rate decreased from 24% to 22%. 8%.

On September 17, 2011, the Occupy Wall Street movement broke out in the United States. The demonstrators claimed to represent 99% of the American people to protest against greed, corruption and social injustice in the financial industry.

context: The weakness of a combat plan is the top secret in the top secret, which cannot be leaked out. However, the "capture" plan of the Japanese Self Defense Force regarding the Diaoyu Islands announced by Japanese media not only predicts three possible scenarios in the future and the Self Defense Force will seize the islands in five steps, but also details the weakness of the Self Defense Force: it lacks the ability to quickly transport troops from the North Sea and Kyushu Island to Okinawa on a large scale to meet the needs of landing operations.
question: If the following statements are true, which one best explains Japan's illogical behavior?
answers: Japan's announcement of the "Island Seizure" plan is intended to test China's reaction: if China's reaction is not significant, Japan will stationed troops on the Diaoyu Islands and surrounding islands.
Recently, China and the Philippines faced off on Huangyan Island, and Japan announced the "Seize the Four Islands" plan to win over the Philippines and work together to contain China.

Japan's self exposed weakness is to create public opinion domestically for the construction of amphibious warships with strong transportation capabilities: amphibious warships belong to offensive forces, while Japan's "Peace Constitution" does not allow the Self Defense Forces to develop offensive forces.

Many Japanese hope that the United States will withdraw its troops from Japan, and Japan's self disclosure of the weaknesses of its self-defense forces is aimed at telling its citizens that Japan still needs the protection of the United States militarily.

context: Wildlife conservation organizations: Without buying and selling, there is no killing; Without killing, only humans and nature can coexist harmoniously.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following statements must be true?
answers: As long as there is killing, there must be buying and selling.
As long as buying and selling are prohibited, humans and nature will coexist harmoniously.

The reason why humans and nature cannot coexist harmoniously is because there is slaughter.

context: Some people argue that exploration is impossible because a person cannot explore what they know or what they do not know. He cannot explore what he knows because he knows it and does not need to explore it again; He cannot explore what he doesn't know because he doesn't know what he wants to explore.
question: Which of the following most accurately points out the logical loophole in this argument?
answers: False assumption: Either you know what you are exploring, or you do not know what you are exploring.
Circular argumentation: Place the conclusion to be argued in advance in the premise.
Forceful reasoning: In terms of rationality, one's skills are limited, so one has to meddle and pester recklessly.
Ambiguous fallacy: "knowing" has two different meanings: knowing what the answer to the question being explored is and knowing what the question being explored is.

context: The bank's credit card regulations stipulate that any transaction made using a password shall be deemed to be made by the cardholder himself. This means that as long as a password is used when a credit card is stolen, the bank will treat it as the cardholder's own act and will not be responsible for any losses incurred. Therefore, in order to make your credit card more secure, you should not set a password.
question: If the following statements are true, they can weaken the above conclusion, except for
answers: Experts believe that credit cards without passwords are more secure, but their words may not be entirely correct.
When criminals forge credit cards with passwords, they must try to obtain their passwords separately in order to successfully steal them.
When a credit card is lost, the password on the credit card can effectively prevent others from swiping the card for transactions.
In cases of theft, if the credit card does not have a password, the court usually determines that the card owner is at fault and is liable for any losses.

context: Plant the same number of eggplant seedlings in two experimental greenhouses, and only apply fertilizer A to the first greenhouse, but not to the second greenhouse. context: A middle school has been piloting a student behavior evaluation system since 2010. answers: Students with low scores are generally dissatisfied with the evaluation system.

context: At present, the utilization rate of arable land in the Far East region in Russia is less than 50%, and the Russian Ministry of Economic Development is interested in long-term leasing of agricultural land to Asia Pacific countries. The Ministry believes that without the injection of foreign capital and labor, Russia will not be able to achieve the revitalization of the Far East region on its own. However, if foreign capital and labor enter the Far East region, the region may be "alienated" by foreign immigrants.
question: If the judgment of the Russian Ministry of Economic Development is correct, which of the following statements must be true?
answers: If Russia introduces foreign capital and labor into the Far East region, the region will achieve revitalization.
If Russia can achieve the revitalization of the Far East region on its own, the region will not be "alienated" by foreign immigrants.

If Russia does not rely on its own efforts to achieve the revitalization of the Far East region, it will face the possibility of the region being "alienated" by foreign immigrants.

context: Convergence is the process in which different species of organisms develop into one or more similar physical features to adapt to the same environment. The similarity between ichthyosaurs and fish is an example of convergence. Ichthyosaurus is a marine reptile that does not belong to the same class as fish. In order to adapt to the marine environment, ichthyosaurs align their physical characteristics with those of fish. The most noteworthy thing is that ichthyosaurs have fins like fish.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following is a reasonable inference from the above statement?
answers: Members of the same class of organisms living in the same environment must have identical physical features.
Just because an organism has similar physical features to members of a certain type of organism cannot be classified as one.
The development of physical features similar to other species of organisms is entirely the result of their adaptation to their living environment.
Members of the same class of organisms must have one or more physical features that distinguish them from other types of organisms.

context: Anti nuclear activists: The closure of this nuclear power plant is a victory for the anti nuclear cause. It shows that the nuclear industry departments are late to admit the fact that they cannot operate nuclear power plants safely. Nuclear Power Plant Manager: It does not indicate such a fact. The availability of direct electricity from non nuclear resources, coupled with mandatory safety inspections and maintenance, makes it uneconomical to continue operating this nuclear power plant. Therefore, closing this nuclear power plant is not for safety reasons, but for economic reasons.
question: The manager's argument is flawed because
answers: It does not acknowledge that power companies may now believe that nuclear power plants are unsafe, even if closing this plant is not for safety reasons.
It regards the cost increase caused by safety precautions as a purely economic factor.
It ignores the possibility that the resources from which cheap electricity can be obtained may also have safety issues themselves.
It mistakenly regards the issue of what closing this nuclear power plant means to the public as the reason for closing the plant.

context: Since the cancellation of mandatory premarital examinations in B city in 2003, the premarital examination rate in the city has dropped from nearly 100% 10 years ago to 7% in 2011, ranking last in the country. At the same time, the incidence of birth defects in newborns in the city has doubled. It can be seen that the cancellation of the mandatory premarital examination system has led to an increase in the rate of birth defects in newborns.
question: The answers to the following questions are relevant for evaluating the above argument, except for
answers: Has the living environment (air and water quality, etc.) of the city been damaged in the past decade?
Has there been a significant increase in unhealthy lifestyles such as staying up late and spending long hours online among the population of childbearing age in the city in the past decade?
Have women in the city postponed childbirth in the past decade, and has the proportion of elderly pregnant women significantly increased?
Has the number of floating population in the city increased or decreased in the past decade?

context: The corpus callosum is a bundle of nerve fibers that connects the two hemispheres of the brain. On average, musicians. The corpus callosum is larger than the corpus callosum of non musicians. Compared to adult non musicians, adult musicians who start training around the age of 7,. question: Which of the following is the hypothesis on which the above argument relies?
answers: Before musicians began training, their corpus callosum was no larger than the corpus callosum of non musicians of the same age.

Adult non musicians did not participate in any activities that could promote the development of the corpus callosum in their childhood.

context: In China, compulsory traffic insurance is a type of insurance chosen independently by insurance companies. Since its launch in 2006, only a small profit has been made in 2008, and the remaining years have all been losses, and the amount of losses has increased year by year. In 2011, the actual operating loss of national compulsory insurance reached 9.2 billion yuan. Strangely, compulsory insurance, which is currently facing huge losses, is still a business that insurance companies are competing for.
question: If the following statements are true, which one best explains the strange phenomenon of insurance companies competing for compulsory insurance business?
answers: In 2011, 3 out of 36 companies undertaking compulsory traffic insurance were profitable in this type of insurance.
In the compensation of compulsory traffic insurance, some vehicles are overpaid, and some cases that should not be compensated are awarded compensation.
Tractors enjoy preferential policies for farmers, and many places register "transportation vehicles" as "tractors", thus enjoying low tax rates.
Commercial car insurance has abundant profits, and car owners usually do not insure compulsory traffic insurance and commercial car insurance separately from two companies.

context: Sales experts believe that in a market that is no longer expanding, the best sales strategy for a company is to pursue maximum market share, and the best way to achieve the goal is to make comparative advertisements that highlight the shortcomings of competitors. In the sluggish domestic milk powder market, A brand milk powder and B brand milk powder have engaged in a two-year comparative advertising war, accusing each other of their products causing harmful effects on the health of infants. However, these advertising campaigns did not increase their respective market share, but instead caused many people to no longer purchase any brand of domestically produced milk powder.
question: Which of the following conclusions does the above statement strongly support?
answers: Comparative advertising should not be used in an expanding or potentially expanding market.
Comparing advertisements carries the risk of causing their target market to shrink rather than expand.
Comparing advertisements will not generate any long-term benefits unless consumers can easily judge the correctness of those advertisements.
If a company's products have significantly higher quality than their competitors' products, comparative advertising can in any case increase the market share of the company's products.

context: Many netizens have doubts about the proposal to solve the pension gap by delaying the retirement age, believing that keeping elderly people who should have retired in their positions will squeeze the employment opportunities of young people and exacerbate their job hunting difficulties. Experts explain that late retirees are both producers and consumers, and their consumption can create new job opportunities.
question: If the following statement is true, which of the strongest geological doubts doubts the expert's explanation?
answers: Delaying the retirement age will face opposition from people working in private enterprises.
Only by stimulating economic development can the unemployment rate be fundamentally reduced.
The pension gap stems from the unreasonable design of China's pension system.
The expert's explanation is based on the unconfirmed assumption that the consumption ability of in-service elderly people is significantly higher than that of their retired peers.

context: In September 2012, the European Union launched an anti-dumping investigation against Chinese photovoltaic cells. Once the European Union decides to impose restrictions on Chinese photovoltaic products, China will lose over 60% of the total sales in the European market. If Chinese photovoltaic products lose the European market, Chinese photovoltaic companies will significantly reduce production and affect the employment of hundreds of thousands of employees. However, a Chinese official said, "If the EU sets restrictions on Chinese photovoltaic products, it will lift a stone and hit itself in the foot
question: If the following statements are true, which one will provide the strongest support for the assertions of Chinese officials?
answers: The Chinese photovoltaic industry has purchased a large amount of raw materials and equipment from Europe, driving the development of a large number of upstream and downstream photovoltaic enterprises in the European Union.
If the EU blocks out high-quality and low-priced Chinese photovoltaic products, European solar energy consumers will pay higher costs as a result.
The solar energy industry is related to the energy security of the European Union, and the natural gas dispute between Russia and Ukraine has once affected EU countries.
At present, the debt problem in Europe continues to worsen, and Germany hopes to seek more help from China to solve the European debt crisis.

context: Run all experimental mice for 1 hour. The first group of experimental mice drank tomato juice one hour before running. The second group drank tomato juice after running. The third group ran for 30 minutes and drank tomato juice. After resting for 1 hour, they ran for another 30 minutes. The control group of experimental mice only drank water. After 6 hours of exercise, the concentration of the substance "TGF-b" that marks animal fatigue in the blood of experimental mice was measured. The results showed that compared with experimental mice that only drank water, the first and third groups of experimental mice showed a 50% to 60% decrease in this indicator. And the second group of experimental mice showed almost no difference.
question: Which of the following is the most suitable conclusion for the above experiment?
answers: Drinking tomatoes can eliminate fatigue caused by exercise.
Drinking tomatoes before exercise can reduce exercise fatigue.
The first three groups of experimental mice ran at the same speed as those that only drank water.
When the intensity and amount of exercise are the same, taking longer breaks between exercises can reduce fatigue.

context: For a long time, smoking in bed has been the main cause of home fires. Although the number of smokers has significantly decreased over the past 20 years, the number of deaths from home fires has not significantly decreased.
question: If the following statements are true, they will help explain the obvious inconsistency above, except for
answers: People who smoke in bed are usually very addicted to smoking, and compared to those who do not smoke in bed, they are less likely to quit smoking.
The population density has been increasing over the past 20 years, and now there are more deaths caused by a family fire than 20 years ago.
Fires caused by smoking in bed usually occur after the homeowner falls asleep.
Compared to other types of household fires, family fires caused by smoking in bed usually result in smaller losses.

context: There are two types of horror stories: one describes the experiments of crazy scientists, and the other tells the stories of fierce monsters. In horror stories about monsters, they symbolize the protagonist's psychological turmoil. The horror stories about crazy scientists typically express the author's feeling that scientific knowledge alone is not enough to guide human exploration activities. Despite these differences, these two types of horror stories share the following common characteristics: they describe phenomena that violate natural laws: they both want to create a sense of fear among readers.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following must be true?
answers: All descriptions of monsters depict phenomena that violate natural laws.
Some stories that use symbolic techniques describe phenomena that violate natural laws.
Most of the stories about crazy scientists express the author's anti scientific views.
Any type of horror story depicts characters with psychological confusion.

context: Since the beginning of summer 2012, the United States has experienced the most severe drought in over 50 years, with two-thirds of its 48 states experiencing moderate to severe drought. It is expected that corn and soybean production will be significantly reduced. However, the report released by the US Department of Agriculture on August 28th predicts that. The net agricultural income of the United States is expected to reach a record high of $122.2 billion in 2012, an increase of 3% compared to last year. 7%.
question: If the following statements are true, which one best explains the two seemingly contradictory predictions mentioned above?
answers: In 2012, many parts of the world suffered from drought, high temperature, rainstorm, typhoon and other natural disasters.
Currently, both international and domestic prices of corn and soybeans have skyrocketed.
American farmers can receive compensation from agricultural insurance to offset some of the impact of reduced production.
In response to the drought, the US government has taken a series of rescue measures for farmers, such as urgently lowering agricultural loan rates.

context: This year, Taifeng Company, a subsidiary of Huatai Group, set a new record for annual sales. This is quite surprising because Taifeng Company has the smallest potential market and has always been the department with the lowest sales among all subsidiaries of Huatai Group.

answers: Due to the smallest potential market for Taifeng Company, it is not surprising that it is the department with the lowest sales volume in Huatai Group.
If the total sales of Huatai Group increase this year, the increase in sales of Taifeng Company is not surprising.

context: Sewage treatment requires a large amount of electricity. By using this technology, sewage treatment plants can not only achieve self-sufficiency in electricity, but also sell the remaining electricity. It can be expected that once this technology is put into commercial operation, the attitude of enterprises towards sewage treatment will become proactive, thereby reducing environmental pollution caused by sewage discharge.
question: Which of the following questions is the most relevant answer to the evaluation of the above judgment?
answers: Will the technology transfer and equipment cost of sewage treatment using this method be high?
Can this technology effectively treat heavy metals in wastewater from chemical plants?
Will this sewage treatment method cause air pollution due to the release of methane?

context: A public service announcement suggested that drinkers should wait until they can drive safely. This result indicates that many people who drink before driving have difficulty following the advice of advertisements.
question: If the following statements are true, which one strongly supports the above statement 2
answers: If some people have to go home after drinking, they will refrain from drinking.
Many people who plan to drink will arrange for a non drinker to drive them home in advance.

Compared to respondents outside the hospital, respondents in the hospital have a more conservative estimate of their abilities.

context: The "placebo effect" refers to the phenomenon where patients unknowingly take fake drugs that have no effect at all, but can achieve the same or even better effects as real drugs. The 'placebo effect' has received support from many clinical studies. One explanation for this phenomenon is that people's expectations for the future can alter the physiological state of the brain, leading to physiological changes throughout the body.
question: The following statements can support the above explanation, except for
answers: The effectiveness of placebo is the result of multiple factors working together.
Placebo has no effect on elderly dementia patients who have lost their ability to anticipate the future.
Some patients do not believe that treatment will be effective, and although they have received normal treatment, their condition continues to worsen.
Inject physiological saline into the experimental subjects and make them believe it is a painkiller, and their brains then secrete the painkiller endorphin.

context: The gun violence in the United States has once again sparked discussions on gun control. Opponents of gun control claim that gun violence in the United States skyrocketed in the 1980s. In 1986, some states implemented strict gun control through legal means, but the average violent crime rate in these states with strict gun control was 1% of the average violent crime rate in other states. 5 times. It can be seen that strict gun control does not help reduce violent crime.
question: If the following statements are true, which one most weakens the above argument?
answers: Since 1986, the proportion of gun owning households in the United States has significantly decreased.
Since 1986, the annual number of violent crimes in these states with strict gun control has continued to decline.
In states that implement strict gun control laws, few people violate them.
Criminologists compared various survey results and found no obvious correlation between the number of privately owned guns and gun violence.

context: With the coming of Mid-Autumn Festival, a supermarket launched a promotional activity to attract consumers by giving a box of moon cakes free when shopping for more than 500 yuan. answers: Customers who are accustomed to small purchases are less likely to be affected by promotional activities.

context: When Einstein published his theory of special relativity, someone asked him, 'What is the expected public reaction?'? He replied, "It's very simple. context: In the book "Reflection on Life," Nozick wrote, "I would not say, like Socrates, that life without reflection is not worth living - it would be too harsh. context: Chinese people hate wealth, and there are so many people talking to scammers just because they are deceiving the rich. context: At present, there are three types of genetically modified rice in China waiting for commercial planting approval, each involving at least 5-12 foreign patents; There are 5 types of genetically modified rice in the research and development process, each involving 10 foreign patents. context: Confucius understood the principles of diet and health preservation very well. The Analects of Confucius, Xiangdang, listed many propositions of "eating" and "not eating", such as "not eating from time to time", which means not to eat out of season vegetables.

context: Tianjin Xu Yunhe case: Xu Yunhe encountered Mrs. Wang crossing the central guardrail of the road while driving. Later, Mrs. Wang fell to the ground and was injured. Xu helped her up, but Mrs. Wang insisted that she had been hit by Xu. After judicial appraisal, Xu's car did not touch her. The court held in the first instance that Xu was only four or five meters away from Mrs. Wang when she met her. She must have fallen due to being frightened by Xu's car. Xu was sentenced to bear 40% of the responsibility and compensate Mrs. Wang with 108606 yuan.
question: Which of the following statements best points out the flaws in the first instance of the case?
answers: The judge's reasoning goes against common sense: Mrs. Wang illegally crossed the guardrail of the road and should have expected a car to be on the motorway, while being frightened is usually due to seeing unexpected things.
This judgment goes against traditional morality: like the Nanjing Pengyu case, it would make the public afraid to lend a helping hand to the injured.
The verdict did not clarify the facts and the evidence was severely insufficient. It is possible that Mrs. Wang fell first and Xu drove over.
The judgment reversed the cause and effect.

context: The "sewage theory" of British doctor John Snow opened the history of epidemiological research. In 1854, a large-scale cholera broke out in London. John Snow found that most of the death cases had drunk the same water pump, while those who used other water pumps or wells were not infected with cholera at first. After investigation, it was found that the wastewater from the sewer polluted the water pump, causing cholera.
question: Which of the following is the method or principle that John Snow did not use in his reasoning?
answers: The factors that exist in various situations where the phenomenon being studied appears are likely to be the cause of the phenomenon.
Factors that do not appear in various situations where the subject of study does not appear are likely not the cause of this phenomenon.
When the subject of the study changes, the factor that synchronously undergoes quantitative change is likely to be the cause of this phenomenon.
The initiative between the occurrence of the research object and the absence of the phenomenon is likely to be the cause of the phenomenon.

context: Nero was the Roman emperor in the first century AD. Every Roman emperor drank wine, using only tin pots and goblets. Whoever uses a tin container to drink alcohol, even if used only once, can still lead to poisoning. And poisoning always leads to mental disorder.

context: About 12000 years ago, when the climate was warming, humans began to move to various parts of North America. context: Rare earth is a collective term for a class of metals with relatively low reserves, widely used in cutting-edge technology and military industries. context: Rural homesteads in China are collectively owned, and farmers can only use them and cannot buy, sell, rent, or inherit them.
